description:
Approach

Descent

P1 - 60m: Bolts are on the creek right of waterfall. Pull down is a little difficult.

Next is a 20m traverse down and to the creek left which can be done without rope but we used rope for safety. There is a large tree to use as an anchor

P2 - 40m: Bolts are on the creek left. Tricky pulldown through scrub 5m down. If you abseil 50m instead of 40m, there is a large comfortable ledge which would make for a better rebelay point (no anchors exist yet).

P3 - 70m: Anchors are 1-2m creek left of where the rope naturally lands. Small uncomfortable ledge.

P4 - 50m: Creek right of falls. Using a tree as an anchor drop down about 4-5m to a rocky outcrop, search around here for last set of bolts.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

  • YouTube.com : YAMA Channel, Allens Falls


Background
name: Flaggy Creek Falls
